meanings.definition: A person who is in love or infatuated.
meanings.sent1: The theater play was full of inamoratos expressing their feelings.
meanings.sent2: The park bench was a favorite spot for young inamoratos to meet.
meanings.sent3: The inamoratos in the romantic comedy kept bumping into each other in hilarious ways.
meanings.sent4: The painting depicted a garden of inamoratos, each lost in their own world.
meanings.sent5: The novel described the protagonist as a hopeless inamoratos, always chasing after love.

meanings.definition: The object of someone's affection or love.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful singer became the inamoratos of many admirers.
meanings.sent2: The precious necklace was the inamoratos of the thief's desire.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy puppy quickly became the family's inamoratos, showered with love and attention.
meanings.sent4: The old watch was the inamoratos of the antique collector, holding sentimental value.
meanings.sent5: The majestic mountain range stood as the inamoratos of the landscape painter, inspiring awe and admiration.
